dt: {bc}to give a {d_link|false|false:1} appearance of {bc}induce as a false impression

dt.t: He {wi}feigned{/wi} that he was not feeling well so that he could leave the party early.
He told the truth because he was no good at {wi}feigning{/wi}.

pt: {sc}assume{/sc} {sc}affect{/sc} {sc}pretend{/sc} {sc}simulate{/sc} {sc}feign{/sc} {sc}counterfeit{/sc} {sc}sham{/sc} mean to put on a false or deceptive appearance. {sc}assume{/sc} often implies a justifiable motive rather than an intent to deceive.

pt.t: {it}assumed{/it} an air of cheerfulness around the patients

pt: {sc}affect{/sc} implies making a false show of possessing, using, or feeling.
{sc}pretend{/sc} implies an overt and sustained false appearance.
{sc}simulate{/sc} suggests a close imitation of the appearance of something.
{sc}feign{/sc} implies more artful invention than {sc}pretend{/sc}, less specific mimicry than {sc}simulate{/sc}.
{sc}counterfeit{/sc} implies achieving the highest degree of verisimilitude of any of these words.
{sc}sham{/sc} implies an obvious falseness that fools only the gullible.

quotes.t: I wince, {qword}feigning{/qword} interest in a TV Guide and mumbling a hello.
Success keeps her busy. "Relaxation?" she asks, {qword}feigning{/qword} puzzlement. "What's that?"
… Brad would sometimes clown or {qword}feign{/qword} clumsiness just to crack her composed expression with a blush or a disapproving frown.

et: Middle English {it}feynen, feignen{/it} "to make, fabricate, make a likeness of, dissemble, pretend to be," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}feign-,{/it} stem of {it}feindre,{/it} going back to Latin {it}fingere{/it} "to mold, fashion, make a likeness of, pretend to be," going back to Indo-European {it}*d{sup}h{/sup}i-n-ǵ{sup}h{/sup}-{/it} (whence also Old Irish con-u{it}tuinc{/it} "builds, constructs,",Armenian {it}dizanem{/it} "[I] heap up"), present tense derivative of {it}*d{sup}h{/sup}ei̯ǵ{sup}h{/sup}-{/it} "knead, shape," whence Gothic {it}digan{/it} "to knead, form from clay," Old Church Slavic {it}ziždǫ, zĭdati{/it} "to build," Lithuanian {it}žiedžiù, žiẽsti{/it} "to form, shape (from clay)" (Balto-Slavic with metathesis of stop consonants), Armenian {it}edēz{/it} "(s/he) heaped up," Tocharian B {it}tsik-{/it} "fashion, shape, build," Sanskrit {it}pari … déhat{/it} "will cover over, smear over"
shortdef: to give a false appearance of : induce as a false impression
to assert as if true : pretend
